meanings.definition: The capability or quality of being able to perform a task or function effectively.
meanings.sent1: Her performability in the dance recital impressed everyone in the audience.
meanings.sent2: The robot's performability in completing complex tasks amazed the engineers.
meanings.sent3: The clown's performability to juggle while riding a unicycle was both entertaining and impressive.
meanings.sent4: The athlete's performability on the field was like a well-oiled machine, never missing a beat.
meanings.sent5: The singer's performability on stage left the crowd in awe, with each note hitting perfectly.

meanings.definition: The extent to which something can be performed or carried out successfully.
meanings.sent1: The performability of the new software was tested extensively before its release.
meanings.sent2: The team evaluated the performability of the plan to ensure its feasibility.
meanings.sent3: The performability of the cat to catch the laser pointer dot provided endless entertainment.
meanings.sent4: The performability of the student in solving complex math problems was like watching a magician at work.
meanings.sent5: The performability of the car's engine in extreme conditions demonstrated its reliability and strength.
